intro: Isochilus teretifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved isochilus, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
